result.execSummary:
The defendant Pierre D Marshall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit a  DNA sample if not already done.  
Court ordered extradition costs in the amount of $100.00 to be paid to Milwaukee County.
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge. Collected by DOC out of up to 25% of prison funds and wages. Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving two (2) years Initial Confinement in this case.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.  No contact with drug community.  
No contact with victim Nicholas B. and the coactors Rafael Hernandez and Victoria Cintron.

Mental health assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department. Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens. No positive results.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include: those as listed.
The Court does not object to the Extended Supervision being transferred to the State of Illinois.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armor or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

5/3/16 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Pierre D Marshall in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Pierre D Marshall in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 5 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 74 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 2 years.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with the victim: Nicholas B. and the co-actors:  Rafael Hernandez and Victoria Cintron.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is set at $0 (ZERO).

Court ordered costs for extradition in the amount of $100.00 to be paid to Milwaukee County.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms/body armour or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs, fees and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, collected by DOC out of up to 25% prison funds and wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 years initial confinement in this case.

The Court does not object to the extended supervision being transferred to the State of Illinois.  

Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Defense submitted Pretrial Incarceration Credit form and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  To be date stamped at the sentencing hearing on 4/27/2016 at 1:30 pm.

Defendant Pierre D Marshall in court with attorney Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Pierre D Marshall in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant sworn.  Plea hearing proceeded.
AS TO COUNT 4:
The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
The Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court informs the defendant he is to provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  
Case adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defense counsel requests projected guilty plea date.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 26.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

The defendant previously posted $1500.00.  Balance due is $8500.00.   Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Attorney Ann T. Bowe in court, defendant Pierre D Marshall not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel informed the Court defendant did not turn himself in.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff.

04/06/2015

Defendant Pierre D Marshall in court with attorney Olya Petukhova for Ann T. Bowe.  Defendant Pierre D Marshall in custody.  Ron Dague for Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Melissa Toms-MPD Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Case is reassigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26 due to co-defendant's lower pending case.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 26.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with N.B.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Pierre D Marshall in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant Pierre D Marshall in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
